Name.label: Syndrome with limb malformations as a major feature
Dysostosis with limb anomaly as a major feature
Genetic syndrome with limb malformations as a major feature
Dysostosis of genetic origin with limb anomaly as a major feature

TextSection.Contents: Heart-hand syndrome refers to a group of congenital disorders characterized by malformations of the upper limbs and heart. To date, heart-hand syndrome comprises the following rare syndromes; Holt-Oram syndrome; heart-hand syndrome type 2; heart-hand syndrome type 3; heart hand syndrome, Slovenian type, brachydactyly-long thumb; and patent ductus arteriosus-bicuspid aortic valve - hand anomalies (see these terms).
